# Heavy Vehicle Registration

Here is the procedure to register a heavy vehicle, renew the registration or obtain a temporary registration certificate (trip permit).

## Heavy vehicles covered

- [Trucks](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/registering-vehicle/truck-weighing-over-3000-kg)
- [Trailers and Semi-Trailers](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/registering-vehicle/trailer)
- [Equipment Transport Vehicles](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/registering-vehicle/commercial-or-special-use-vehicle/equipment-transport-vehicle)
- [Tool Vehicles](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/registering-vehicle/commercial-or-special-use-vehicle/tool-vehicle)
- [Tow Trucks](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/registering-vehicle/commercial-or-special-use-vehicle/tow-truck)
- [Buses and Minibuses](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/registering-vehicle/bus-minibus)

## International Registration Plan (IRP)

If you use certain heavy vehicles to transport goods or passengers outside Québec, you are required to register those vehicles in the [International Registration Plan](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/vehicle-international-registration-plan) (IRP).

## Vehicle Registration Renewal

Heavy vehicle owners must renew their [vehicle registration](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/renewal-vehicle-registration) every year.

Temporary registration certificate (trip permit)

The owner of a heavy vehicle that is not registered in Québec or in the IRP, but used for the transportation of goods or passengers in Québec, must obtain a [registration certificate for a single trip](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/vehicle-registration/temporary-registration-certificate), commonly referred to as a “trip permit”, every time they travel in Québec.

Last update: May 17, 2022

## Safety first, on the road and online

We are committed to protecting your personal information and privacy. That’s why, when we collect data, we follow a [Policy on Privacy](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/policies/privacy) that is responsible and transparent. By continuing to browse without modifying your preferences, you accept the use of cookies.
